greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array in which n-th row consists of numbers with digit product n arranged in increasing numerical order; row consists of 0 in no such numbers exist.
comment: 1 is not allowed as a digit, except in first row.
If n has any prime factor other than 2,3,5 or 7 then a(n) = 0.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..1000, flattened
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 13 2002
ext: Corrected and extended by _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 24 2013
